result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marie J Bentley

records.addlTxt: 1:58 PM Defendant Marie J Bentley appeared by video from RC Jail  Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 20CF140, 21CF107, 22CF15, 22CF27, 22CF51, all return on warrant.  DA Anderson addresses the cases, all bonds had been revoked per the request of Ms Bentley, State asks the court to quash warrants.  Cases have previously been set for November 10, 2022 @ 10:15. These will remain on the calendar.
Waive reading of the Information, enter a plea of NG.
Review hearing on November 10, 2022 at 10:15 am.

9:31am Defendant Marie J Bentley appeared by video from RC Jail.  Attorney Richard Louis Yonko in court for Marie J Bentley.  Attorney Emily Nelson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Yonko calls the cases.  These cases have not resolved, new counsel will need to be appointed. Heard along with 20CF140, 21CF107, 21TR226, 22CF15, 22CF27, 22CF51, 22CF135.  
22CF135-Waive reading of the Information, enter a plea of NG.
Review hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:26 AM Defendant Marie J Bentley appeared by video from RC Jail.  Attorney Richard Louis Yonko appeared by video for Marie J Bentley.  Attorney Emily Nelson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Heard along with 20CF140, 21CF107, 21TR226, 22CF15, 22CF27, 22CF51, 22CF135. All set for Status but 22CF135-Init App. 

22CF135-Waive formal reading of the CC. DE/Atty will waive the right to a PH.  Court instructs on waiver of PH, DE makes waiver knowingly, freely and voluntarily, court will accept waiver of PH. Set cases for Arraignment/P/S October 5, 2022 @ 9:00am. 

Atty would like to address bond, asking for release on a sign bond or revoking of all bonds.  State is not prepared to address bond, victim right notification in 22CF135.  Court will maintain the current bond in 22CF135 and revoke all bonds in other cases.  Adj 9:35am.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:57 AM Defendant Marie J Bentley appeared by video from RC Jail.  Attorney Emily Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Richard Louis Yonko in court for Marie J Bentley. Heard along with 20CF140, 21CF107, 21TR226, 22CF15, 22CF27, 22CF51, 22CF135.  

22CF135-DE wishes counsel, will reschedule Init App when counsel is appointed to case. 

22CF51-PH. 10:00AM-State calls Deputy Ben Reisner, oath administered.  Direct by the State.  Court will take notice of certified bonds filed by the State. Witness has identified the Defendant.  10:02-Cross by Defense. 10:03am Witness dismissed.  Argument by Atty Yonko, does not believe State has meet its burden.  Court will find PC, will bind over for Trail.  Set 22CF135 for INit App August 16, 2022 @ 9:30AM.  Other cases will be set for trial.  Parties will discuss order of cases and contact JA for dates. Adj 10:07am.
Initial appearance on August 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:39 PM Defendant Marie J Bentley appeared by video.  Attorney Emily Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Richard Louis Yonko in court for Marie J Bentley. Heard along with 21CF107, 21TR226, 22CF15, 22CF27, 22CF51, 22CF135-Init App.  

22CF51-PH set for August 4, 2022 @ 10:00.  Set 22CF135 for Init App, all other cases set for RH.  Adj 1:43pm.
Any cash bond posted for Defendant shall be used for fines, costs and restitution pursuant to WI STAT 969.13(5). No contact with Ace Hardware.

8:46 AM Defendant Marie J Bentley appeared by video from RC Jail.  PD Rockow appears with DE via video. State appears by ADA Emily Nelson.  Victims have been notified of hearing.  State asks for cash bond $2500.00, no contact with Ace Home Center.  8:49am Atty Rockow wishes to speak with DE in a breakout room. 8:52am back on the record.  Atty Rockow informs DE will appear for all court appearances, lives locally in Ladysmith with her father.  

The court will order a $500.00 cash bond.  No contact with Ace Hardware. Will set for Init App July 25, 2022 @ 1:00 PM.  if complaint is ready. Adj 8:56am
